text: [Music]
when I reviewed Dark Souls 2 on
Playstation 3 Xbox 360 and PC on March
11th 2014 I gave it a 9.0 which is a
mark of an amazing game here's what I
said then Dark Souls I is a smart
massive and incredible rewarding sequel
It's crammed with deep systems tense
encounters and enough clever multiplayer
and New Game Plus elements to make me
want to restart the second I saw the end
credits not all of the tweaks and
additions worked out for the best but
with such great enemies and levels to
fight and explore Dark Souls 2 made 60
hours of pain and Agony so much fun they
flew by in a
heartbeat Dark Souls 2 scholar of the
first sin does more than wrap up the
original game in its DLC for the play 4
and Xbox One it's taken everything that
worked so well in the original version
the Intriguing World fantastic combat
and rewarding Challenge and noticeably
improve them with a handful of much
appreciated adjustments and
additions coming from the Xbox 360 and
PS3 versions the most notable
enhancement comes from the 1080p 60
frames per second visual upgrade it's
even a little bit nicer looking than the
original PC version seeing maula at dusk
for the first time is even more
spectacular thanks to sharper textures
more more detailed character models and
gorgeous lighting effects that fill the
world of drying Lake many of Dark Souls
2's dungeons are bathed in darkness
forcing you to keep a torch on you at
all times and the illumination created
by these crackling fires looks fantastic
don't let that distract you though
because scol the first sin takes what
was already a difficult game and makes
it even tougher powerful new enemies are
now strutting around early
environments for example a single KN
that guarded this area in Heidi's Tower
of flame has now been replaced by this
fire breathing dragon
enemy placement has also been reshuffled
and even though I've spent upwards of
100 hours in the world of Dark Souls I
this experience felt fresh and
unfamiliar be warned though while I
appreciated these new challenges it
seems like scholar the first sin might
be a tough entry point for newcomers to
the soul series the final great addition
to scholar of the first sin is the crown
trilogy DLC which is now included from
the start crown of the sunken King
delivers one of the most interesting
dungeons the series has ever seen
twisting paths smart puzzles and tons of
interactive environments make it a joy
to play through likewise crown of the
ivory King culminates in a massive
exciting battle that unfolds on a scope
larger than any boss fight in the
series over a year after its initial
release Dark Souls 2 still manages to
impress the visual enhancements make
scholar of the first sin feel right at
home on a new gen system while the
additional enemies and reshuffled
placement deliver a powerful dose of
that special kind of torture that Souls
fans climber for with the included DLC
Dark Souls 2 scholar of the first sin is
an even better version of one of our
favorite games of 2014 but maybe a bit
tougher to get into trust me though it's
worth it for more on Dark Souls stick
right here on IGN
[Music]
